because energy champions are? lets look at the most banned and/or hated champs right now. Zed - energy based, Akali - energy based, lee sin - energy based, hell even kennen is becoming more popular because of his great AP poke and easy sustain. the only champions that are energy or resource based that suck ass are top laners (seriously, why are all the top lane resourceless champions noteably weaker? oh yeah, they were so strong first half of last season that nothing else could compete so they nerfed them all except like renekton, and then AP tops jumped in to poke their way to victory.)

Now let's look at their win rates.

Swain (really mana hungry) -55%
Zed and Lee - 45%

Look at their pick rates.  Now look back at their win rates.  See anything interesting?  Oh, I dunno, maybe like how Swain has a 4.02% pick rate (which means that only people that know how to play him play him) to a 53.91% win rate?  Zed has a 15.82% pick rate to a 48.35% win rate, and Lee has a 27.8% pick rate to a 45.73% win rate.

Are you kidding me?  Noobs and FotM players flock to the most "OP" champ and usually lose a lot with them because they have no idea how to play them.  THAT'S why the win rates for some of the strongest champs in the game are so low.  Ever think about that?  I doubt it.
But if they are unbalanced, why do they lose games when you don't know how to play them?

Just because a champion is OP doesn't mean you don't have to learn how to use them.  That'd be like someone picking Dr.Doom, Magneto, and Vergil(top tier monsters) in Marvel vs Capcom and just rubbing their face on the controller expecting to win :P
It seems to work for Brolylegs
I am so glad I didn't have a drink in my mouth when I read this.
...But that *is* how you play those three.

That would be a good argument if those weren't their consistent win rates. Zed normally hovers at a win rate around 47-48%, Lee Sin is normally around 45-46% win rate. Are those champions strong? Yes, and have a ton of potential in their kit. However, to consistently succeed on the likes of Zed and Lee Sin requires significant mechanical skill. Thats one of the reasons why they don't receive a lot of nerfs; yeah they are potentially game changers and carry super hard if in the right hands, but thats the key. In the right hands. Its fair balance for a champion to have a strong kit but to actually utilize it properly require a significant skill level. Most of the people who complain about Lee Sin or Zed or the like on the fourms are either: A) bad/got recently stomped by one, or B) dislike them for their popularity. The balance of a champion should not depend on their popularity. I mean, its just logical reasoning that if X champion is OP/Broken then X champion should consistently be winning more than average. Also, if a champion is really popular, then you should know how to play with and against them. Akali would be a fair complaint champion in regarding needing nerfs cause she is strong but has a low skill floor and a consistently above average win rate (but, as loathe I am to say it due to my burning hatred for Akali, shouldn't probably get massively nerfed cause her's isn't super higher than average). And back to the Original Post, that is just a dumb excuse anyone like that would give no matter what champion they are playing; from 'Lucky I ran out of energy' if on Zed, 'Lucky I ran out of mana' if on Oriana, etc. They are just excuses.
